title: All Your Questions about Getting a Prescription for Duromine Answered

steps.title: You need a prescription from a doctor.
steps.content: You need a prescription from a doctor. Duromine is usually prescribed in conjunction with a weight loss program and a diet plan. If you would like to start taking Duromine, you can talk to your primary care doctor to see if it’s right for you. [1] X Research source While you may be able to find Duromine online without a prescription, it’s unregulated and may be dangerous to take.

steps.title: No, not necessarily.
steps.content: No, not necessarily. If you are overweight or obese, you can talk to your doctor about taking Duromine. Most medical professionals will only prescribe it if you also commit to an exercise and diet plan, though, so keep that in mind. [2] X Research source Duromine is similar to an amphetamine, which is why it might be slightly more regulated than other medications.

steps.title: Yes, it’s called phentermine.
steps.content: Yes, it’s called phentermine. Other names for Duromine include Adipex-P, Lomaira, and Suprenza. If you have insurance, talk to your provider about finding the cheapest option for you. [3] X Research source Generic brands are usually cheaper than name brands, but it might depend on your coverage.

steps.title: It depends on your diet and exercise plan.
steps.content: It depends on your diet and exercise plan. Everybody is different, and your weight loss on Duromine depends a lot on where you’re starting and what you couple it with. Your doctor can help you monitor your progress to make sure you’re staying within a healthy range, and they’ll let you know if you need to stop taking Duromine. [4] X Research source Duromine is the most successful when coupled with a diet and exercise plan. Without that, you probably won’t lose much weight at all.

steps.title: Don’t take Duromine if you’re allergic to anything in it.
steps.content: Don’t take Duromine if you’re allergic to anything in it. Duromine capsules contain phentermine, lactose monohydrate, liquid paraffin, magnesium stearate, gelatin, titanium dioxide, and iron oxide black (CI 77499). If you know you’re allergic to any of these, talk to your doctor about an alternative. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Anyone under the age of 12 shouldn’t take Duromine.
steps.content: Anyone under the age of 12 shouldn’t take Duromine. There haven’t been any studies on the effects of Duromine on children. If you’re young, stick to diet and exercise to keep your weight under control. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Don’t take Duromine if you’re pregnant or have an underlying condition.
steps.content: Don’t take Duromine if you’re pregnant or have an underlying condition. Duromine isn’t safe for people who are pregnant or breastfeeding. Similarly, you shouldn’t take Duromine if you have a history of heart disease, you have high blood pressure, you have an overactive thyroid, you have glaucoma, or you’re taking other diet pills. [7] X Research source
